line.en: 'I'm going to the secret base too.'
'Hmph! I see.'
Ageha had a bored-sounding tone to her voice as\nshe said 'See you tomorrow' and left the\nclassroom.
'OK, let's go, Kotori.'
'Yeah.'
'Was it really alright for your to turn down\nAgeha's invitation?'
'What do you mean?'
'Well...'
'...Aoi, do you have something you need to do at\nthe secret base?'
'Umm, well not really.'
Since Kotori's going, I thought I'd go with her.
Even if I did go with Ageha, I'd only end up\ncarrying her bags for her.
'You were about to say something just then. What\nwas it?'
'No, it's nothing really.'
We spoke on our way out of the school gate.
'Aoi!'
'Hello, Aoi!'
A group of first-year girls called out to me.
Almost immediately, they had surrounded me.
'Erm... hello.'
'Are you leaving now?'
'Do you have club activities now?'
'Yeah, well, I guess so.'
It seems that they are Asa's friends.

Seems like Asa was proudly talking in her
classroom about how she'd joined the Soaring
Club, which is fine, but it looks like her
friends have become interested in it.
It's strange that their interest isn't in the\nglider, but rather, in me.
Now they're coming to greet me and ask all kinds\nof questions.
'Asa's clumsy, so does that cause you any\ninconvenience?'
'Hahaha, that's not true. Asa is trying really\nhard.'
There's nothing really wrong with this, but I'm\nnot used to it, so I feel kind of uncomfortable.
With a fake smile on her face, Kotori watches me\nfrom outside the circle.
'Hey, Aoi. I'm going on ahead.'
'Ah! Wait!'
'You're so cool! And you're tall as well!'
'Asa said you're really kind too!'
'Oh, did she now?'
'...No, I mean, hey, Kotori!'
Kotori had made a face that said that she\ncouldn't stay with me, and had already gone off\nahead.
Opening the metal door and going inside, there\nwas Kotori working alone in the huge dock.
'I can't believe you left me behind!'
'More importantly, I couldn't bear watching you\nwith that stupid expression on your face.'
She wasn't as angry as I thought she'd be, but\nshe was still a little blunt.
'Come here, I bought you some ice cream. It's\nHargen Darch Strawberry flavor!'
Kotori glared at me from a distance.
Then, she pushed her wheelchair towards me.
'Here you go.'
'Thanks.'
We sat in the corner of the dock, eating ice\ncream.
'I think you have to eat ice cream in a hot\nplace.'
Where we are now couldn't be any hotter.
'Hey, Aoi.'
'Yeah?'
'When people eat ice cream, it puts them in a\nbetter mood, don't you think?'
With the plastic spoon still in her mouth, she\ngives me a sideways look.
'I don't think so.'
'Well, whatever. It tastes good.'
I guess that's her perspective on it, but it\nlooks like she accepted this as a form of\napology.
'What were you doing?'
'...Maintaining the tools. After that, I was\ngonna do some cleaning.'
'You came here all by yourself to do that?'
Kotori nods while eating her Hargen Darch.
'We could all do that tomorrow, together.'
'...If we all did it together, I'd just be a\nburden.'
Kotori seems a bit sullen as she speaks.
I reflect on having said something that didn't\nneed to be said.
Kotori's in a wheelchair, so whether we're\nworking, cleaning, or whatever it may be, she\ncan't do it the same way as everyone else.
No one thinks of her as a burden, but I guess\nthere is a difference in the amount of work she\ncan do.
Kotori's worried about that, and everyone else\nseems to be aware of that.
'When we do something, everyone is always looking\nout for me, I realize that.'
'I don't like it. It makes me sad.'
'Yeah...'
We can't completely avoid looking out for her.
The reason we do that is because she's important\nto us.
But I can understand why that makes things tough\nfor her.

When I got injured and had to quit the Cycle
Racing Club, having my friends look out for me
sometimes made me happy, and sometimes it was
tough.
Kotori usually doesn't show that she sometimes\nfinds that tough.
She can be cheerful at times, and at others, she\nmakes selfish request like it's no big deal.
The fact that she can say what she really thinks\naround us is a relief to us.
'It's really pitiful, you know. Even though I'm\nthe leader.'
'I caused problems with that thing with the\nrunway...'
'I think you know this but no one except you\nworries about it.'
'Yeah.'
...(wells up).
Tears appear in Kotori's eyes.
'Don't start crying all of a sudden. C'mon,\nyou'll spoil the ice cream that I went to the\neffort of buying for you.'
Oh no, she's hanging her head even more now.
I don't know what's triggered this but she's gone\ninto 'fainthearted mode'.
I put my hand on her head, the same as always,\nand start stroking it.
'There, there, it's nothing to cry about, is it?'
'I'm... not crying. ...It's sweat. Sniff.'
Kotori starts sniffing.
This year, Kotori has been working really hard as\nthe leader of the Soaring Society.
She doesn't have the same level of expert\nknowledge or techniques as Ageha, and she can't\nbe a pilot like me either.
It looks like there's nothing that only Kotori\ncan do.
But, in the past, like the time that we found out\nthat Amane would be leaving, whenever there's a\ndifficult situation,
Kotori is always the one who says 'I wanna do it\nlike this!' and expresses herself the strongest\nof all of us.
'Kotori has a straightforward nature, like a\nchild, and she's like a compass, showing us the\ndirection in which he should be heading.'
'Yeah...'
Kotori slowly ate her ice cream while crying.
She looked like a child who'd become timid after\nbeing scolded by her mother.
It was kind of... cute.
'...What is it?'
'It's...it's nothing. C'mon, eat up!'
I couldn't help myself looking at her crying, and\nwithout thinking, I blushed while trying to cover\nit up.
I think everyone knows how hard she's trying.
She's disabled, so even something like pushing\nher wheelchair all the way to the secret base all\nby herself is really tough.
But to Kotori, that is perfectly natural, but she\nis also worried about not being able to move\naround like everyone else.
She has an unusually strong sense of\nresponsibility, so she's concerned about\ninconveniencing other people.
However, originally, the girl known as Kotori\nHabane, was just a regular girl.
She looks cute, and her grades and general\nsporting abilities were probably better than most\npeople, but that's about it.
Also, she's easily moved to tears, she's a little\nself-conscious, and when she tries too hard, she\nsometimes cries.
When did it start? I guess from the time I\npersuaded her not to quit school, it's been my\nduty to comfort her.
It seems like she only cries in front of me.
Maybe that's what she needs.
I think that when she cries, she can let out all\nthe things she's been bottling up.
'There, there, you're trying ever so hard,\nKotori. You're trying ever so, ever so hard.'
'...Geez, don't make fun of me, alright?'
While still crying, she gives me a punch in the\nside.
It doesn't really hurt though.
I stroke her head and hug her gently.
'Sorry. But... this is kind of embarrassing.'
As I speak honestly to her, Kotori pushes her\nforehead into my chest, then cries without making\na sound.
While holding Kotori's head, one part of me wants\nher to stop crying, but another part of me wanted\nto stay like this for a little longer.
'...Thank you, I feel better now.'
said Kotori, moving her forehead away from me.
She pours the totally melted ice cream into her\nmouth as though it were juice.
'Anytime you need to borrow my chest, you let me\nknow. I won't charge you any rental fees.'
I said jokingly, then...
'Of course. Because in return, you get to stroke\nthe head of a beautiful girl, and gently... hug\nher.'
'I'd say those are the perks of the job, wouldn't\nyou?'
'You can't say things like that about yourself,\nyou know.'
'Alright, you can go now.'
'...So now that you've stopped crying, my work\nhere is done?'
'Why don't you go and hang out with all those\nfirst-year girls from before?'
As she says that, she goes back to work.
'Oh. Is this what they call jealousy?'
Fwoosh!
'Woah, that's dangerous!'
A spanner came flying at me.
'Damn, I missed.'
'What the hell are you doing!? What would you\nhave done if that had hit me?'
'Why on earth would I be jealous!? What are you,\nstupid?'
'But it sounds like you're jealous to me.'
Fwoosh, fwoosh!
'Woooah!'
This time, it's a screwdriver and a pair of\nnippers that came flying.
'Please just go already. You're stopping me from\nworking.'
she said, while clutching a power drill.
Sensing danger, I do as she says.
'Alright, I'm off now but if you need anything,\nyou can reach me on my cell.'
'Also, let me know when you're gonna come leave,\nI'll come and get you.'
'There's no need.'
'No, no. Once it gets dark, I can't let you go\nback by yourself.'
'Make sure you call me, OK?'
As I emphasize my point, I open the metal doors\nand leave the dock.
'You don't even think of me... as a girl. Hmph!'
